result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky L. Landa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Shall undergo and follow through with any treatment/counseling as directed by agent.
Shall undergo anger management counseling and follow through as directed

All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established. 
Shall submit a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Shall serve 90 days w/h&t & child care to be used at the agent's discretion.
Consecutive to: with work release, transfer and child care privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky L. Landa

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am. - sent to defendant at the Dodge County Jail

records.addlTxt:
01:00 PM 21CF361 & 22CF54 Defendant Ricky L. Landa in court.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Ricky L. Landa.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court finds victim rights compliance, victim is present in courtroom but does not wish to make a statement.  Attorney Tienstra heard on joint stipulation and recommendation.  Court questions defendant and reviews chgs and pens. Defendant enters NC plea in Count 2 of Case No. 21CF361 and NC plea in Count 1 of Case No. 22CF54.  Court finds plea's were made f/v/k/i;  accepts plea's and finds defendant Guilty in Count 2 of Case No. 21CF361 and Guilty in Count 1 of Case No. 22CF54.  Counts 1 & 3 in Case No. 21CF361 are DRI. Attorney Tienstra heard on sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Findley heard.  Defendant waives statement.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows.

21CF361 - Count 2 & 22CF54 - Count 1

w/held sentence - 2 years probation
90 days DCJ (NOT condition of probation) - to be used as agents discretion w/huber for child care and employment
AODA
counseling/treatment per agent
any anger management counseling per agent
court costs
DNA
report to P/P by 4 PM on Monday

* - court does not order further contact restrictions

10:45 AM  Called 21CF361 and 22CF54. Defendant Ricky L. Landa in court.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Ricky L. Landa. Atty Findley heard, requests a status conference date, not ready to proceed to P/S today. Atty Tiesnstra heard, requests this be set for another IPSC/possible P/S. Discussion held. Court heard, will schedule a trial date in the event the IPSC/PS doesn't conclude the matter.

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim and residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

01:03 PM Defendant Ricky L. Landa in court, in custody with attorney Katherine Marie Findley (eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ricky L. Landa appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $300 Cash bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim and residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
